summary.p: The bundle contains two works attributed to Auvaiyār: the Ātticūṭi (complete) and the Koṉṟaivēntāṉ (incomplete; first nine aphorisms only). These works are often used for learning the Tamil alphabet as the aphorisms are ordered alphabetically and represent all the letters of the Tamil alphabet. The present manuscript, from Pondicherry (see U1b, f[6]r, c2, 3), might be a school exercise, as it contains mistakes apparently due to inexperience (e.g. confusion between the letters ṉ and ḷ, of similar shape). The lay-out of the page is in columns for the mūlam.

binding.p: Woodcovers (pinewood) apparently fabricated in the BnF.

origin.origDate: 1842–1843. See U1b, f6r: cupakiṟa = cupakirutu year of 60-year the Jovian cycle.

acquisition.p: The f20v (library foliation), that is U3, f11, the last of the blank folios, is inscribed: "R.B. [N]° 4530 bis. 1847." The "Registre B" of the BnF records under this entry atthe date of August 15th, 1847, the acquisition of 4 items from "Schwaighauser. Elèvede l'école des chartes". Our manuscript, the first item in the list, is described as: "Un ms tamoul sur palmes, de 20 feuillets ??? (la) couverture, attaché avec un cordon rouge ???".

encodingDesc.p: Abbreviations. c = column, f = folio, lm = left margin, r = recto, rm = right margin, U = unit (codicological and/or textual), v = verso.

Transliteration conventions. Unmarked puḷḷi, ō, and ē restored. Conjectural (whether the text is not clearly legible or the character is ambigous, e.g. kāl or length of o and e) readings between parentheses. Alternative readings between parentheses separated by slash. Lost or entirely illegible character: "?". Crossed-out character: "X". Conjectural restoration of lost or entirely illegible between square brackets. Uppercase for initial vowels (in excerpts only). Unquoted text represented by (...). Conjunct letter: e.g. t°, to be read tum or tam. Grantha letters in bold. Symbols/Abbreviations made explicit, between curly brackets: {pcs} = piḷḷaiyār cuḻi, short form; {pcl} = piḷḷaiyār cuḻi, long form, that is, with long horizontal stroke towards right; {varuṣam}, {mācam}, {tēti}; {line-filler}. Unfoliated folio number between square brackets, e.g. "f[1]r". Numerals normalised to decimal notation, e.g. "1121" not "1000 1 100 2 10 1". Hyphen occasionaly used to mark in-word components. Hyphen systematically used at the end of a line when the line-beginning is within a word or within a cīr. Sandhi split to the minimum: overshort u occasionally restored as an apostrophe. Stanzas split by cīr, as far as possible. aṭi boundary marked by "‡".
